decks.notes: This deck revolves around a powerful combination of cards that allows for quick and explosive wins. It utilizes a variety of fast mana sources, such as Moxen and Lotus, to generate a large amount of mana early in the game. The deck also includes cards like Gitaxian Probe and Brainstorm to filter through the deck, finding important pieces of the combo. The key card in the deck is Tinker, which allows the player to search their deck for powerful artifacts like Time Vault and Bolas's Citadel. Once assembled, the player can generate infinite turns or storm off with Tendrils of Agony for a lethal finish.

The main concept of this deck revolves around using the card Oath of Druids as a control tool. The deck aims to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategies and utilizing powerful spells such as Show and Tell and Tinker to put powerful creatures or artifacts onto the battlefield. The deck also includes a mix of counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect its own plays. Additionally, the inclusion of Oko, Thief of Crowns and Atraxa, Grand Unifier suggests that the deck focuses on gaining incremental advantages and controlling the board state.

This deck aims to quickly establish board control and disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a solid midrange strategy. It utilizes powerful cards like Force of Will and Deathrite Shaman to protect its own threats and disrupt the opponent's spells. The deck also includes a selection of versatile counterspells and card draw spells to maintain card advantage and ensure consistency. With the inclusion of cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Leovold, Emissary of Trest, the deck can generate additional value and create difficult board states for the opponent to overcome. The deck's land base includes various fetchlands and dual lands to ensure consistent and flexible mana.

This deck revolves around playing aggressive creatures, primarily Squee, Goblin Nabob, Basking Rootwalla, and Hollow One, to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The key concept involves utilizing the card Bazaar of Baghdad to cycle through your deck and put creatures into your graveyard, triggering effects like Vengevine and Noxious Revival to bring them back onto the battlefield. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Mindbreak Trap and Force of Will to control the opponent's plays and maintain a strong board presence. Wasteland and Strip Mine are included to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Chalice of the Void is used to hinder the opponent's spells, while Force of Negation and Force of Vigor provide additional disruption and protection. Master of Death and Fury are included as additional threats.

The key strategy of this Vintage Combo - Doomsday deck is to use Doomsday to set up a winning combination of cards in the most efficient way possible. The deck utilizes powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall, Brainstorm, and Preordain, as well as tutors such as Mystical Tutor and Vampiric Tutor, to find and set up a Doomsday pile. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo and control the game. Thassa's Oracle and Demonic Consultation are key pieces of the win condition, allowing the player to win the game by either drawing out their deck or exiling it entirely.

This Vintage Combo - Paradoxical Storm deck focuses on utilizing the combination of Paradoxical Outcome and artifacts to generate a significant amount of mana and card advantage. The deck includes powerful cards such as Time Vault, Time Walk, and Ancestral Recall to gain extra turns and draw additional cards. It also includes various Moxes and other artifact accelerants to ramp up the mana production. The deck aims to chain together spells and artifacts with Paradoxical Outcome, generating more mana and card draw each time, ultimately leading to a game-winning storm turn.

The key concept of this Azorius Initiative deck is to leverage a combination of aggro strategies and control elements to dominate the Vintage 1 vs 1 format. With a mix of powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Demonic Tutor, the deck aims to quickly gain card advantage and disrupt opponents' gameplay. The inclusion of strong creatures like Sphinx of the Steel Wind and Hullbreacher, along with efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, provides both offensive and defensive options. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful mana sources such as Moxen and Sol Ring to accelerate its game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards through the use of cards like Serum Powder, Bazaar of Baghdad, and Dredge creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and Golgari Thug. Once the graveyard is filled, the deck aims to take advantage of this by utilizing cards like Narcomoeba, Stinkweed Imp, and Prized Amalgam to create a powerful board presence. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Mindbreak Trap to protect its combo pieces. Additionally, the deck includes some disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Grief to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently storm off and win the game by milling your own deck, using cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer. By sacrificing creatures like Narcomoeba and Chancellor of the Annex, you can then use Dread Return to bring back a powerful card like Thassa's Oracle, creating a win condition. The deck also includes numerous powerful mana sources like the Moxes and Black Lotus to accelerate your combo, as well as disruption and protection spells like Force of Will and Pact of Negation to control the game and ensure your combo goes off successfully.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Aggro deck focused on utilizing the powerful Bazaar of Baghdad to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Serum Powder and Force of Vigor to enable explosive plays. The deck aims to rapidly deploy aggressive creatures like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis, Vengevine, and Hollow One while using cards like Bloodghast and Blazing Rootwalla to generate consistent pressure. It also includes disruptive elements like Collector Ouphe and Chalice of the Void to disrupt opponent strategies. The key concept of this deck is utilizing Bazaar of Baghdad's graveyard-filling ability to enable explosive plays and overwhelm opponents.
